title: Server lag?
body:
I've played 2 games, one all for one, and one ranked, I'm sitting at 10 ping, 11 if I'm unlucky. But I'm getting lag
Now I've played with 250 ping, I've played with 30, and 80, I know what your typical lag is, I'm getting lag where I can move fine, but I can't cast fine, there is a 3 second delay when placing wards, and enemies appear next to me with no warning.
It would be fantastic if I could have my last game as a loss prevented (though with our adc thresh bot lane idk....) I have all my port forwarding and QoS set up and I'm running at 10 ping and it's not spiking while playing. 4 other people in my team was also getting lag, 3 team mates in all for one and one in ranked, any ideas?

replies.body:
Hey ShadowsNight,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.

Basic UDP access is available.

The client was able to send fragmented UDP traffic.

The client was unable to receive fragmented UDP traffic. The most likely cause is an error in your network's firewall configuration or NAT.
The maximum packet successfully received was 1499 bytes of payload.

which I think makes sense since I'm able to move around, it's not like I'm bouncing around with normally lag. I've just checked some settings with my modem and think I may have found an issue? it's odd that it's only just started happening though so I'm still not sure, I had set up service tables for my games but when I looked at inbound firewall rules it was empty, seems like I need to assign the rule to a IP address on the network? 

Here are some screenshots:
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/119007269269667840/194614317616726029/unknown.png
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/119007269269667840/194614464618692611/unknown.png
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/119007269269667840/194614668386369537/unknown.png

I ran the test again, http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/restore/id=369839a0-23399-934edce7-667f-4df2-8142/rd any idea what is going on?

Hi ShadowsNight,

Have you continued to experience the odd delays? Did you commit those changes in the screenshot to your network settings and if so, are you still getting that message in the network diagnostic when you run it?

Yeah I applied those settings and made my PC a static IP to make sure the rules applied to my computer, it's not as bad but I'm still getting the odd spike/DC and considering I'm on the NBN with a direct connection to my computer I don't think it's on my side, I've also tried a different modem with the same results. Here is another test from my phone

http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/restore/id=369839a0-12900-c1f36a3c-e3db-4f56-a433/rd

Yeah I applied those settings and made my PC a static IP to make sure the rules applied to my computer, it's not as bad but I'm still getting the odd spike/DC and considering I'm on the NBN with a direct connection to my computer I don't think it's on my side, I've also tried a different modem with the same results. Here is another test from my phone

http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/restore/id=369839a0-12900-c1f36a3c-e3db-4f56-a433/rd
